required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Thrombocytopenia and Bleeding in Wiskott-Aldrich Syndrome (WAS) Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Effects Of Eltrombopag On Thrombocytopenia, Platelet Function and Bleeding In Patients With Wiskott-Aldrich Syndrome/X-Linked Thrombocytopenia.

lead_sponsor.agency: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

clinical_study.source: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this project is to describe the pathophysiology of thrombocytopenia and bleeding in patients with Wiskott-Aldrich Syndrome (WAS) and determine the response to thrombopoietic agents in vitro and in vivo.

detailed_description.textblock:
Wiskott Aldrich Syndrome is an X-linked disease characterized by immunodeficiency, eczema and thrombocytopenia; a milder form of the disease known as X-Linked thrombocytopenia also exists. The thrombocytopenia in both WAS and XLT is characterized by: severe thrombocytopenia with platelet counts frequently less than 10-30,000/ul; small platelets which may be dysfunctional; and, as a result, a high rate of serious bleeding including intracranial hemorrhage.
Because eltrombopag has been shown to be remarkably efficacious in substantially increasing platelet counts in a high percentage of ITP patients, this study seeks to effectively treat patients who exhibit similar pathologies, as well as evaluate the state of platelets in patients with WAS and relate it to clinical bleeding. It also aims to demonstrate whether eltrombopag administered daily will enhance stem cell function, increase platelet production and platelet count, and reduce bleeding in patients with WAS.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: group of 11 WAS patients treated with eltrombopag WAS patients who had their blood drawn once but did not receive eltrombopag treatment healthy children as controls for testing only 3) healthy volunteers who had their blood drawn once

primary_outcome.measure: How Many WAS Patients Will Achieve Platelet Counts Above 50,000/ul.
primary_outcome.description: number of WAS patients achieving this increase to > 50,000/uL without rescue medication in the previous 3 weeks during eltrombopag treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Wiskott-Aldrich Syndrome (WAS) With Grade 3 or Higher Bleeding or SAE (on WHO Scale)
secondary_outcome.description: number of patients with bleeding SAEs while on treatment and/or number of patients with grade 3 or higher bleeding on WHO (World Health Organization) scale: the scale is from 1 to 5 with 5 = fatality and 1=very little bleeding

secondary_outcome.measure: How Many Patients With WAS Had Abnormal Platelet Function Including Activation
secondary_outcome.description: in how many patients with WAS were platelets dysfunctional or activated before treatment as measured by flow cytometry to a substantial degree and the same after treatment with eltrombopag

secondary_outcome.measure: How Many Patients With WAS Had Substantially Increased Platelet Production After Eltrombopag
secondary_outcome.description: in how many patients with WAS did eltrombopag increase platelet production as measured by the immature platelet fraction (IPF), a variable derived from the Sysmex auto analyzer, which is considered to be a measure of newly formed platelets ie reticulated platelets

arm_group.description: Promacta® is commercially available in 12.5 mg, 25 mg, 50 mg, and 75 mg tablets. For this study, for young children unable to swallow a tablet, eltrombopag powder for oral suspension (Eltrombopag PfOS) will be used. PfOS is only available for investigational use at 20mg. Each sachet contains eltrombopag equivalent to 20mg per gm of powder and is reconstituted to a total of 10 ml so that the concentration is 2 mg/ml.

arm_group.arm_group_label: WAS patients for blood drawing only
arm_group.description: WAS patients not receiving treatment to serve as subjects for platelet parameter studies blood drawing once only

arm_group.arm_group_label: healthy children for blood drawing only
arm_group.description: healthy children having blood obtained once as controls for platelet parameters study

intervention.description: WAS Patients receiving treatment will start on 1 mg/kg of eltrombopag daily and be seen weekly for 12 weeks. Dose adjustment will be based on the weekly monitoring of the platelet count as utilized in ongoing studies in ITP as well as on liver tests. they will also have diagnostic blood testing prior to initiating treatment

intervention.intervention_name: blood drawing in patients with WAS
intervention.description: blood will be drawn for platelet parameters in WAS patients not receiving treatment either because they declined or because they were ineligible
intervention.arm_group_label: WAS patients for blood drawing only

intervention.description: blood will be drawn once in healthy children as controls for platelet parameters
intervention.arm_group_label: healthy children for blood drawing only

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
In order to be eligible for study entry, subjects must comply with the following:
- Males from 3 months old to 80 years old
- Signed written informed consent obtained prior to study entry
- Clinical diagnosis of WAS or XLT
- Platelet levels less than 100 x 109/L
- Adequate renal and hepatic function (creatinine and bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x IULN, AST and ALT less than or equal to 2.5 x IULN)
Exclusion Criteria:
Any patient is ineligible for study entry if he/she:
- Over the age of 80
- Women (only males are eligible)
- fertile men who are not practicing or who are unwilling to practice birth control while enrolled in the study or until at least 6 months after treatment
- Aspirin, aspirin-containing compounds, salicylates, non-steroidal anti-inflammatory medications (NSAIDS), clopidogrel or ticlopidine, warfarin or other vitamin K antagonists, unfractionated or low molecular heparin within 7 days of first infusion
- Red blood cell transfusion in the past four weeks
- Elevated (> 1.5 x ULN) prothrombin time (PT) or partial thromboplastin time (PTT)
- New York Heart Classification III or IV heart disease. Other severe cardiovascular or cardiopulmonary disease, including COPD.
- Known HIV infection, hepatitis B or C infection
- Any infection requiring antibiotic treatment within 3 days
- Other concurrent medical or psychiatric conditions that, in the Investigator's opinion, may be likely to confound study interpretation or prevent completion of study procedures and follow-up examinations.
- Prior malignancy with less than a 5-year disease-free interval, excluding nonmelanoma skin cancers and carcinoma in situ of the cervix

overall_official.affiliation: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: 24 patients' families signed consents 11 WAS patients for treatment: 1 mother signed consent but never consented to have her very young baby start study treatment (dietary issues) + 1 withdrew 8 WAS patients' parents only were willing to have study bloods drawn 5 normal healthy children had their parents give consent for a blood draw

group.title: WAS Patients Treated With Promacta
group.description: Promacta® is commercially available in 12.5 mg, 25 mg, 50 mg, and 75 mg tablets. For this study, for young children unable to swallow a tablet, eltrombopag powder for oral suspension (Eltrombopag PfOS) will be used. PfOS is only available for investigational use at 20mg. Each sachet contains eltrombopag equivalent to 20mg per gm of powder and is reconstituted to a total of 10 ml so that the concentration is 2 mg/ml. Promacta (eltrombopag): WAS Patients will start on 1 mg/kg of eltrombopag daily and be seen weekly for 12 weeks. Dose adjustment will be based on the weekly monitoring of the platelet count as utilized in ongoing studies in ITP. Eltrombopag/promacta: Patients will start on 1 mg/kg of eltrombopag daily and be seen weekly for 12 weeks. Dose adjustment will be based on the weekly monitoring of the platelet count as utilized in ongoing studies in ITP.

group.title: WAS Patients for Blood Drawing Only
group.description: patients with WAS whose parents did not want them to receive treatment but were willing to let them have their blood drawn to increase the number of patients studied for platelet parameters with WAS

group.title: Healthy Children
group.description: platelet parameters (primarily function) needed normal controls in children-----three were pre-op and two siblings were being tested as potential bone marrow donors

participants_list.participants: 1 patient started bleeding 3 days after starting eltrombopag; he underwent bone marrow transplant

group.title: Promacta
group.description: Promacta® is commercially available in 12.5 mg, 25 mg, 50 mg, and 75 mg tablets. Each sachet contains eltrombopag equivalent to 20mg per gm of powder and is reconstituted to a total of 10 ml so that the concentration is 2 mg/ml. Promacta (eltrombopag): Patients will start on 1 mg/kg of eltrombopag daily and be seen weekly for 12 weeks. Dose adjustment will be based on the weekly monitoring of the platelet count as utilized in ongoing studies in ITP. Eltrombopag/promacta: Patients will start on 1 mg/kg of eltrombopag daily and be seen weekly for 12 weeks. group.title: Healthy Volunteers
group.description: 5 well children having blood drawn for another reason: 3 pre-op and 2 for HLAA-typing

group.title: WAS Patients for Blood Drawing Only
group.description: patients with WAS either not eligible or not interested in eltrombpopag treatment who are willing to have their blood drawn once

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: How Many WAS Patients Will Achieve Platelet Counts Above 50,000/ul.
outcome.description: number of WAS patients achieving this increase to > 50,000/uL without rescue medication in the previous 3 weeks during eltrombopag treatment
outcome.population: 1 WAS subject withdrew prior to starting treatment and was not included in the analysis. Healthy volunteers were neither WAS patients nor received eltrombopag (both required for achievement of primary outcome #1). The WAS patients who were blood draw only also were 0 since they did not receive eltrombopag.

group.title: Promacta
group.description: Promacta® is commercially available in 12.5 mg, 25 mg, 50 mg, and 75 mg tablets. For this study, for young children unable to swallow a tablet, eltrombopag powder for oral suspension (Eltrombopag PfOS) will be used. PfOS is only available for investigational use at 20mg. Each sachet contains eltrombopag equivalent to 20mg per gm of powder and is reconstituted to a total of 10 ml so that the concentration is 2 mg/ml. Promacta (eltrombopag): WAS Patients will start on 1 mg/kg of eltrombopag daily and be seen weekly for 12 weeks. Dose adjustment will be based on the weekly monitoring of the platelet count as utilized in ongoing studies in ITP. Eltrombopag/promacta: Patients will start on 1 mg/kg of eltrombopag daily and be seen weekly for 12 weeks. Dose adjustment will be based on the weekly monitoring of the platelet count as utilized in ongoing studies in ITP.

group.description: 8 normal subjects will be studied for degree of platelet activation from one blood draw by collaborator Alan Michelson at Boston Childrens Hospital

group.title: Healthy Volunteers
group.description: 8 normal subjects will be studied for degree of platelet activation from one blood draw by collaborator Alan Michelson at Boston Childrens Hospital

group.title: WAS Pts: Blood Drawing Only
group.description: WAS patients who are either no eligible for treatment or do not want it and agreed to have blood drawn once

measure.title: How Many Patients With WAS Had Abnormal Platelet Function Including Activation
measure.description: in how many patients with WAS were platelets dysfunctional or activated before treatment as measured by flow cytometry to a substantial degree and the same after treatment with eltrombopag
measure.population: 1 subject withdrew prior to starting treatment and was not included in the analysis

outcome.title: How Many Patients With WAS Had Substantially Increased Platelet Production After Eltrombopag
outcome.description: in how many patients with WAS did eltrombopag increase platelet production as measured by the immature platelet fraction (IPF), a variable derived from the Sysmex auto analyzer, which is considered to be a measure of newly formed platelets ie reticulated platelets
outcome.population: 1 subject withdrew prior to starting treatment and was not included in the analysis. no treatment with eltrombopag was given to healthy volunteers and WAS patients who were blood drawing only so the effect of treatment in these 2 groups could not be assessed

reported_events.time_frame: 12 weeks of treatment was the focus-----subsequent information (after 12 weeks) did not demonstrate any problems
reported_events.desc: in how many patients and in how many events was there an increase in transaminases to > 2 times the upper limit of normal. Note, one patient was never treated and thus 10, not 11, patients were evaluable for adverse events

increase in transaminases to > 2X upper limit of normal

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
